Home About Me Notes

§Do I want to stay with Mieke

Mieke: Diary

An alternate framing may be: Do Mieke and I work well together?

This is a sub-question of What I value being in a romantic relationship and Make romantic relationships thrive.

Most relationships include a healthy dose of conflict and discomfort (It is normal to experience discomfort, A meaningful life contains discomfort). Whether the relationship is worth it, that's important. And, even more important, whether Mieke is the person you want to be with.

This is really examining whether Mieke is a good fit for What I value in a partner. It's unlikely you'll find the perfect partner, so it's important that you Compromise on the unimportant. This means that you want to gauge how important the below points are, not just whether you perceive them as deficits.

Would I be friends with Mieke if we weren't romantically involved?

::Would I regret not looking for a partner I share more values with?:: I only spent 6 effective months looking for partners My uncertainty causes suffering for the both of us.

Things we can work on

  • What can Mieke and I care about together?

  • Mieke and I are both in doubt about children

    • Mieke is strongly in doubt about children
    • §Do I want parenthood

  • Mieke dislikes debate

Things I can improve

  • Nurture relationships through connection

  • Nurture relationships by fulfilling values

    • Share passion with your partner

  • Amplify your partners excitement

  • Share concerns with your partner

  • Seduce your partner

  • Make debates a safe space

Things that have gotten better!

  • Comparison to others induces suffering

  • Trying to improve predicts well-being

  • Mieke no longer expects me to entertain her

  • Explicitly recognise resistance

  • Don't judge someone for their emotions

  • Act through discomfort

Against making a change

  • Life as a new doctor is lonely

What works well Mieke cares about us being happy * Mieke gives me a ton of leeway * We help each other explore who we want to be

  • Have fun with your partner

  • Be honest with your partner

  • Be willing to improve with your partner

    • Change with your partner

  • Face problems as a team

  • Value caring

Challenges we face

When things get tough, do I want to be on the same team as Mieke * Mieke is easily destabilised by changes * Mieke may not be great at solving problems

Share values with your partner * Value curiosity * Mieke isn't curious * Mieke has few interests * Mieke isn’t interesting * Mieke gets sad when not at school * Mieke isn't morally curious * Mieke gets frustrated in discussions * Mieke isn't as intelligent as I am

* [[§Nobility]]
	* [[Mieke isn't skilled]]
	* [[Mieke isn't ambitious]]
		* [[Mieke may be poor at acting independently (mother)]]

* [[Value caring]]
	* [[Mieke's kindness doesn't extend beyond those she like]]
	* [[Mieke speaks Dutch with her parents]]
	* [[Mieke desires common, slow paced routines]]

Share passion with your partner * Mieke is more materialistic than I am

Emotions

  • Emotional stability predicts relationship satisfaction
  • Share values with your partner
  • A positive outlook predicts well-being

Action

  • Mieke avoids negative affect
  • Completing common chores improves well-being

If you keep being in doubt, remember that It is unreasonable to expect others to change, If seriously in doubt about a major life decision, it's best to take action and see the appendix in ACT with Love.

Consider back-testing to other relationships.

Backlinks

  • My examples of thought and feeling control strategies can cause problems
    • This means that I don't spend as much time with her, and I don't get to understand her. While effective in the short term, it is horribly ineffective in the long term. However, it may be useful until we get a regular day working and I get more data on whether I want to stay with her, §Do I want to stay with Mieke.
  • You should enjoy conversations with those you care about
    • This is part of §Do I want to stay with Mieke.
  • I feel worse than when I was single
    • §Do I want to stay with Mieke
  • Romantic relationships thrive with similar intelligence
    • For §Do I want to stay with Mieke, it becomes relevant for me because I Value curiosity highly, and curiosity is much easier if you're intelligent; you can get by more easily in your daily work, and you can explore more challenging areas in the rest of life.
  • Decide whether you're committed to the relationship
    • This means that it makes sense to systematically go through §Do I want to stay with Mieke
  • 13/11/2020
    • Not only that, but we have limited time! The more time we squander away, the less time we have to live a life that’s worthwhile. This means that I need to consider §Do I want to stay with Mieke more carefully; I don’t want to waste her nor my time, and that requires that I either act as a good boyfriend or I go somewhere else.
  • Intellectual novelty is good for the world
